text:
# 
When participants were asked, “What are the access points for your program”, a wide range of answers were given. After examining responses, 8 major themes were identified. In addition to the eight specific access points and their corresponding sub-categories, a few miscellaneous answers have been listed. 
# 
\begin{tabular}{llcc}
\hline 
& & \textbf{Definition} & \textbf{Frequency} \\
\hline 
\textbf{Marketing/Media Ads} & & Marketing or advertising efforts disseminated through & 67 \\
& & media outlets like newspapers, magazines, TV, radio, phone & \\
& & book, newsletters and church bulletins. Examples include & \\
& & On the Town, Grand Rapids Press, East Grand Rapids & \\
& & Cadence, Forest Hills Advance, El Vocero, and Women's & \\
& & Lifestyle Magazine. & \\
\hline 
\textbf{Word of Mouth} & & -- & 61 \\
\hline 
\textbf{Mailers/Flyers/Brochures} & & Print resources such as flyers, brochures, or postcards that are distributed to potential or recurrent clients via direct & 45 \\
& & are distributed to potential or recurrent clients via direct & \\
& & mail or in person. &  \\
\hline 
\textbf{Website/Internet} & & Organization's website or other Internet listing. & 42 \\
& & & \\
\hline 
\textbf{Referrals} & & -- & 36 \\
& & & \\
\hline 
\textbf{Networking} & & Contact with individuals or organizations that could lead to & 19 \\
& & increased participation in programs. Includes recruiting, & \\
& & indirect referrals, etc. & \\
\hline 
\textbf{Newsletter} & & Includes school newsletters & 14 \\
& & & \\
\hline 
\textbf{Walk-ins} & & -- & 2 \\
\hline 
\end{tabular}
